00029 import os
00030 import tempfile
00031 
00032 from Koo.Fields.AbstractFieldWidget import *
00033 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00034 from PyQt4.QtGui import *
00035 from PyQt4.uic import *
00036 
00037 from Koo.Common import Common
00038 from Koo.Common import Semantic
00039 
00040 (BinaryFieldWidgetUi, BinaryFieldWidgetBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('binary.ui') ) 
00041 
00042 class BinaryFieldWidget(AbstractFieldWidget, BinaryFieldWidgetUi):
00043         def __init__(self, parent, model, attrs={}):
00044                 AbstractFieldWidget.__init__(self, parent, model, attrs)
00045                 BinaryFieldWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00046                 self.setupUi(self)
00047 
00048                 # Versions prior to 5.0 used 'fname_widget' instead of 'filename'
00049                 # attribute.
00050                 if 'fname_widget' in self.attrs:
00051                         self.attrs['filename'] = self.attrs['fname_widget']
00052                 self.connect( self.pushNew, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.slotNew )
00053                 self.connect( self.pushRemove, SIGNAL('clicked()'),self.slotRemove )
00054                 self.connect( self.pushSave, SIGNAL('clicked()'),self.slotSave )
00055 
00056                 self.installPopupMenu( self.uiBinary )
00057                 
00058         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00059                 self.uiBinary.setEnabled( not value )
00060                 self.pushNew.setEnabled( not value )
00061                 self.pushRemove.setEnabled( not value )
00062 
00063         def menuEntries(self):
00064                 pix = QPixmap()
00065                 if self.record.value(self.name):
00066                         enableApplication = True
00067                 else:
00068                         enableApplication = False
00069 
00070                 if pix.loadFromData( self.record.value(self.name) ):
00071                         enableImage = True
00072                 else:
00073                         enableImage = False
00074                 return [ (_('Open...'), self.openApplication, enableApplication), 
00075                          (_('Show &image...'), self.showImage, enableImage) ]
00076 
00077         def openApplication(self):
00078                 if not self.record.value(self.name):
00079                         return
00080 
00081                 # Under windows platforms we need to create the temporary
00082                 # file with an appropiate extension, otherwise the system
00083                 # won't be able to know how to open it. The only way we have
00084                 # to know what kind of file it is, is if the filename property
00085                 # was set, and pick up the extension from that field.
00086                 extension = ''
00087                 if 'filename' in self.attrs:
00088                         fileName = self.record.value( self.attrs['filename'] )
00089                         if fileName:
00090                                 extension = '.%s' % fileName.rpartition('.')[2]
00091 
00092                 fileName = tempfile.mktemp( extension )
00093                 fp = file(fileName,'wb+')
00094                 fp.write( self.record.value(self.name) )
00095                 fp.close()
00096                 Common.openFile( fileName )
00097 
00098         def showImage(self):
00099                 if not self.record.value(self.name): 
00100                         return
00101                 dialog = QDialog( self )
00102                 label = QLabel( dialog )
00103                 pix = QPixmap()
00104                 pix.loadFromData( self.record.value(self.name) )
00105                 label.setPixmap( pix )
00106                 layout = QHBoxLayout( dialog )
00107                 layout.addWidget( label )
00108                 dialog.exec_()
00109 
00110         def slotNew(self):
00111                 try:
00112                         filename = QFileDialog.getOpenFileName(self, _('Select the file to attach'))
00113                         if filename.isNull():
00114                                 return
00115                         filename = unicode(filename)
00116                         value = file(filename, 'rb').read()
00117                         self.record.setValue( self.name, value )
00118                         self.uiBinary.setText( _('%d bytes') % len(value) )
00119 
00120                         # The binary widget might have a 'filename' attribute
00121                         # that stores the file name in the field indicated by 'filename'
00122                         if 'filename' in self.attrs:
00123                                 w = self.attrs['filename']
00124                                 self.record.setValue( w, os.path.basename(filename) )
00125                                 if self.view:
00126                                         self.view.widgets[w].load(self.record)
00127                 except:
00128                         QMessageBox.information(self, '', _('Error reading the file'))
00129 
00130         def slotSave(self):
00131                 filename = QFileDialog.getSaveFileName( self, _('Save as...') )
00132                 if not filename:
00133                         return
00134                 try:
00135                         fp = file(filename,'wb+')
00136                         fp.write( self.record.value(self.name) )
00137                         fp.close()
00138                 except:
00139                         QMessageBox.information(self, '', _('Error writing the file!'))
00140                         return
00141                 Semantic.addInformationToFile( filename, self.record.group.resource, self.record.id, self.name )
00142 
00143         def slotRemove(self):
00144                 self.record.setValue( self.name, False )
00145                 self.clear()
00146                 self.modified()
00147                 if 'filename' in self.attrs:
00148                         w = self.attrs['filename']
00149                         self.record.setValue( w, False )
00150                         if self.view:
00151                                 self.view.widgets[w].load(self.record)
00152 
00153         def showValue(self):
00154                 if self.record.value( self.name ):
00155                         size = len( self.record.value( self.name ) )
00156                         self.uiBinary.setText( _('%d bytes') % size ) 
00157                 else:
00158                         self.clear()
00159 
00160         def clear(self):
00161                 self.uiBinary.clear()
00162 
00163         # This widget is a bit special. We don't set the value
00164         # here. We do it in the slotNew, so we don't have two copies
00165         # of the file (which can be pretty big) in memory.
00166         def store(self):
00167                 pass
00168 
00169         def colorWidget(self):
00170                 return self.uiBinary
